Title: Sentinel ICBM Electrical Engineer – Airborne Systems

Description: * Who we are: * Our purpose is to add life to a lifetime of learning. We have more than 20,000 employees that deliver our products and services in nearly 200 countries, all working towards a common purpose – to help everyone achieve their potential through learning. We do that by providing high quality, digital content and learning experiences, as well as assessments and qualifications that help people build their skills and grow with the world around them. * This position sits within our Virtual Learning Business, specifically in Pearson Online Learning Services (POLS) Partner & Student Services/Learning Design Solutions (LDS), helping to support our various academic partner institutions in Higher Education. * Your role: * This position reports to the Director of Instructional Design and Development, under the direction of the Vice President for Partner and Student Services. You will be accountable for leading, optimizing and expanding learning analytics capabilities across learning design and student services, among other POLS functions dedicated to student success. This role will be responsible for contributing to POLS success in the following ways: * Lead learning analytics efforts across POLS portfolio and with new business; including developing personalized learning analytics strategies for partners and translating the needs of customers into appropriate data-informed solutions. *  Collaborate with cross functional teams of content developers, instructional designers, and business analysts to define and deliver on POLS learning analytics roadmap and support customer data needs *  Work closely with partner institutions as well as support internal initiatives with end-to-end research support, including working with key stakeholders to generate and test hypotheses *  Expand Pearson’s thought leadership in educational research and learning analytics through the publication of academic papers, conference presentations, and authoring white papers *  Support team efforts to become increasingly data-driven and establish a culture of data-informed decision making *  Mine large structured and unstructured educational data to glean actionable insights and make evidence-informed recommendations on how the data can be used to help solve business problems with direction *  Build data pipelines to extract, load, and transform educational data from multiple sources and then communicate this data in ways that meet the needs of the intended audience (e.g., dashboards and/or reports) *  Willingness to stay up to date on learning science research and ongoing advances in learning analytics methods to develop the next generation of learning analytics solutions * Your qualifications: * An advanced degree from an accredited institution with a doctoral-level degree strongly preferred *  5-8 years of experience in higher education, educational research, statistics, psychometrics, data science. *  Strong background in educational research and deep knowledge of key findings in the learning sciences. *  Extensive experience and expertise in analyzing behavioral and outcomes data from various platforms and systems; experience working with educational data sources (e.g., learning management systems, digital courseware) a plus. *  Proven ability to write academic papers and present research findings at conferences or in business engagements. *  Extensive knowledge and experience with database development, statistical techniques, data collection, data warehousing, data mining, data modeling, statistical modeling, predictive modeling, and data visualization. *  Extensive technical expertise in cloud-based technologies (AWS & Google Cloud), SQL, R, Python, JavaScript, Snowflake, Tableau Desktop & Tableau Server.
